class Clustering_Arguments[source]

Clustering_Arguments(batch_size:int, num_clusters:int, embedding_path:str, data_pct:Optional[float]=None, num_clusters_elements:Optional[int]=None, cluster_output_path:str=None, cluster_only:bool=False, random_state:int=0, cluster_input_path:Optional[str]=None, cluster_n_jobs:Optional[int]=-1, centroid_elements_only:bool=False)

Clustering_Arguments(batch_size: int, num_clusters: int, embedding_path: str, data_pct: Union[float, NoneType] = None, num_clusters_elements: Union[int, NoneType] = None, cluster_output_path: str = None, cluster_only: bool = False, random_state: int = 0, cluster_input_path: Union[str, NoneType] = None, cluster_n_jobs: Union[int, NoneType] = -1, centroid_elements_only: bool = False)

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

class Clustering_Processor[source]

Clustering_Processor(cluster)

A processor class that makes it easy to obtain indices from clusters with various methods

{% endraw %}

tests

{% raw %} 
# Load the embeddings, if you don't have, download it from the following URL:
# https://s3.amazonaws.com/models.huggingface.co/bert/prajjwal1/albert-base-v2-mnli/cls_embeddings_mnli.pth
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
clustering_args = Clustering_Arguments(
    batch_size=32,
    num_clusters=32,
    embedding_path="/home/nlp/experiments/cls_embeddings_mnli.pth",
    data_pct=0.2,
    cluster_output_path="/home/nlp/experiments/tmp/c.pth",
)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
embeddings = torch.load(clustering_args.embedding_path)
embeddings = np.concatenate(embeddings)  # (392702, 768)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
clustering = MiniBatchKMeans(
    n_clusters=clustering_args.num_clusters,
    batch_size=clustering_args.batch_size,
    random_state=clustering_args.random_state,
).fit(embeddings)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
clustering_proc = Clustering_Processor(vars(clustering))
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
# Take top n% data by specifuing data percentage
cluster_indices = clustering_proc.get_cluster_indices_by_pct(
    clustering_args.data_pct, embeddings.shape[0]
)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
# Specify num_clusters you require for sampling
clustering_args = Clustering_Arguments(
    batch_size=32,
    num_clusters_elements=32,
    embedding_path="/home/nlp/experiments/cls_embeddings_mnli.pth",
    num_clusters=8,
    cluster_output_path="/home/nlp/experiments/tmp/c.pth",
)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
cluster_indices = clustering_proc.get_cluster_indices_by_num(
    clustering_args.num_clusters_elements
)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
# Or take only the centroids
cluster_indices = clustering_proc.get_cluster_indices_from_centroid(embeddings)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
from transformers import GlueDataTrainingArguments as DataTrainingArguments
from transformers import AutoTokenizer, GlueDataset
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
data_args = DataTrainingArguments(task_name = 'MNLI', data_dir = '/home/nlp/data/glue_data/MNLI')

tokenizer = AutoTokenizer.from_pretrained('albert-base-v2')

train_dataset = GlueDataset(data_args, tokenizer)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
train_dataset = torch.utils.data.Subset(train_dataset, cluster_indices)
